alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan; Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 9:27PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Harlan, northeastern Bell and east central Knox Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 927 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Callaway, or 8 miles east of Pineville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Molus and Rella around 945 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Stony Fork Junction, Coldiron, Wallins Creek, Tacky Town, Field and Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
